reviewText: Ernest Borgnine, as New York Police Lieutenant, Joe Petrosino, determined to end the reign of The Black Hand (a group of extortionists) in Little Italy. Fighting The Black Hand and the people's prejudice for the police, Petrosino forms an Italian squad of police to end The Black Hand's reign of terror.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an old movie but supposed to be a true story of a cop who fought the mob in NYC.  He then goes to Sicily to try to talk to the mob boss.  really good.
Title: N/A

reviewText: FANTASTIC! "NOT YOUR EVERY DAY ERNEST BORGNINE FILM; YOU THOUGHT HE WAS TOUGH IN FROM HERE TO ETERNITY, YOU MUST SEE THIS!! SHOWS TWO DIFFERENT SIDES OF THIS GREAT ACTOR. THANKS ERNIE, FOR ALL OF YOUR WONDERFUL FILMS!!!!  LARRY W.

reviewText: Great movie that tells it like it was and (is?) Borgnine was born to play this role, interesting and exciting from beginning to end.+

reviewText: A true story about a Italian NYC police officer battleing organized crimein early 1900 new York city. Low budjet but stillgood. The sceen where a youngster is hurt simply becauseher father hasen't paid his protection money is ruff to see, even for today's standards.The third party responsable for delivery had problems. Beside that all was well.
